abstract.text: Copies pixel data from the first slice of the texture to a buffer in system memory.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to a destination buffer in system memory.
The number of bytes (
stride
) between two adjacent rows of pixel data in the destination buffer.
For
and
, use
. For raw and packed pixel types, the stride is the number of pixels in one row.
For compressed pixel formats, the stride is the number of bytes from the beginning of one row of blocks to the beginning of the next.
Your data type determines how you should compute
For raw or packed pixel data, use a multiple of the pixel size less than
For compressed pixel data, use a multiple of the compression block size. When working with PowerVR Texture Compression (PVRTC), use
Nonzero values smaller than the texture width or any values not a multiple of the pixel or block size cause an error.
The location of a block of pixels in the texture slice. For textures compressed as PVRTC, use the entire texture for the region.
A zero-indexed value that selects the texture’s mipmap level as the method’s data source. Use
for textures that don’t have mipmaps.
Don’t use this method for textures where
is
. Instead, copy data from the private texture with an
to another texture accessible from the CPU, and then call this method on the accessible texture.

This method runs on the CPU and immediately copies the pixel data from the texture to system memory but doesn’t synchronize with any GPU texture accesses. Ensure all operations that write or render to the texture complete before reading the texture’s contents, using one of the following methods:
Synchronize on the GPU with a
or
command in an
Synchronize on the CPU with a callback passed to the
method to handle completion asynchronously, or the
method to block thread execution until the GPU work completes.
For multisample textures, the method consecutively positions each sample within a pixel in memory and treats the pixels as part of one row.

abstract.text: The maximum representable integer in this type.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An interface you can use to encode GPU commands that copy and modify the underlying memory of various Metal resources.
Encodes a command that synchronizes the CPU’s copy of a managed resource, such as a buffer or texture, so that it matches the GPU’s copy.
Encodes a command that synchronizes a part of the CPU’s copy of a texture so that it matches the GPU’s copy.
Registers a completion handler the GPU device calls immediately after the GPU finishes running the commands in the command buffer.
Blocks the current thread until the GPU finishes executing the command buffer and all of its completion handlers.
The bounds for a subset of an object’s elements.
The location and access permissions of the resource.
The resource is only available to the GPU.
A resource that holds formatted image data.
Copies pixel data from the texture to a buffer in system memory.
Copies pixel data from the first slice of the texture to a buffer in system memory.
An array of one-dimensional texture images.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
